qas.question: What was the title of Nirvana's 1991 album?
What was the hard rock style that emerged in the early 1990s?
What are some grunge bands with a strong 1970s influence?

answers.text: Pearl Jam, Alice in Chains, Mother Love Bone and Soundgarden

qas.question: What 1990s hard rock band had a big stadium rock sound?
What element made Oasis unique among 1990s Britpop bands?
Who had success with the soft rock song Nevermind in 1991?
What form of music combined the clean sound of heavy guitar to produce feedback?
What kind of bands were consistent with mainstream hard rock?
What form of music did Stone Temple Pilots turn into mainstream hard rock?
What aesthetics did all grunge bands embrace?

context: While these few hard rock bands managed to maintain success and popularity in the early part of the decade, alternative forms of hard rock achieved mainstream success in the form of <a1_0>grunge<a1_0/> in the US and Britpop in the UK. This was particularly evident after the success of <b5_0>Nirvana<b5_0/>'s <a0_0>Nevermind<a0_0/> (1991), which combined elements of <b6_0>hardcore punk and heavy metal<b6_0/> into a "dirty" sound that made use of heavy guitar distortion, fuzz and feedback, along with darker lyrical themes than their "hair band" predecessors. Although most <b7_0>grunge bands<b7_0/> had a sound that sharply contrasted mainstream hard rock, several, including <a2_0>Pearl Jam, Alice in Chains, Mother Love Bone and Soundgarden<a2_0/>, were more strongly influenced by 1970s and 1980s rock and metal, while <a3_0>Stone Temple Pilots<a3_0/> managed to turn <b8_0>alternative rock<b8_0/> into a form of stadium rock. However, all grunge bands shunned the <b9_0>macho, anthemic and fashion-focused aesthetics<b9_0/> particularly associated with glam metal. In the UK, Oasis were unusual among the Britpop bands of the mid-1990s in incorporating <a4_0>a hard rock sound<a4_0/>.
